1. When this Epistle is read among you] As to the first; The Apostle wished this his Epistle to be published and read in a usual assembly of the whole Church, that all might know it. Hence we derive two Corollaries :

l. That the Sacred Scriptures were not written for the end that they should be the peculial· property of a few of the clergy3 but that they should be open to the whole Christian people, and should be known of all. Hence that the ordinary reading of the Scriptures obtained in the pri- mitive Church, (l Thess. v. 27.) and that in a language un- derstood by the people, is clear from Justin Martyr, in Apolog. 23 from Tertullian, in Apologet.; and from other Fathers.
